newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Distrigas to invest 12 to 15 bln bfr.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Distrigas to invest 12 to 15 bln bfr.

text.p: Belgian natural gas distributor Distrigas/Distrigaz, a unit of utility holding company Tractebel SA, plans to invest 12 to 15 billion francs in the improvement of its gas distribution network, the company said on Tuesday.

The investments will boost the gas transit capacity of the Distrigas network from its Interconnector terminal in the port of Zeebrugge to four points at the Belgian borders: Blaregnies, Eynatten, 's Gravenvoeren and Zelzate.

Work on the project will start in the spring of 1997 and is set to be completed by October 1998 when the Interconnector will receive its first gas shipments from a pipeline from Bacton, on Britain's east coast.
